odeComponent.htmlView: By the end of this module, you will be able to identify common causes of cross-functional miscommunication and apply practical strategies to improve alignment across teams.

odeComponent.htmlView:
Think about the last cross-functional project you were part of. What made it feel smooth — or frustrating?

Cross-functional collaboration is essential to getting work done, but it’s also one of the most common sources of confusion, delays, and missed expectations.

{"ideviceId":"202601101944082746EB","textInfoDurationInput":"","textInfoDurationTextInput":"Duration","textInfoParticipantsInput":"","textInfoParticipantsTextInput":"Grouping","textTextarea":"

onsibilities.%20One%20team%20may%20consider%20work%20complete%20once%20it%20is%20handed%20off%2C%20while%20another%20expects%20additional%20testing%2C%20review%2C%20or%20refinement.%20%20Without%20a%20shared%20definition%20of%20success%2C%20teams%20may%20believe%20they%20have%20completed%20their%20work%20while%20others%20feel%20key%20steps%20are%20missing%20causing%20delays%20and%20frustration.%20"}],"isScorm":0,"textButtonScorm":"Save
